alert.note: Alert for Lee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 2:39PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lee County through 330 PM CDT... At 239 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Auburn, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Opelika, Beauregard, Beans Mill, Auburn University, Loachapoka, Robert G. Pitts Airport, Chewacla State Park and Mount Jefferson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
